official-title.#text:
To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to
		  establish a Medicare payment option for patients and eligible professionals to
		  freely contract, without penalty, for Medicare fee-for-service items and
		  services, while allowing Medicare beneficiaries to use their Medicare
		  benefits.

header.#text:
Guaranteeing
			 freedom of choice and contracting for patients

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended to read as follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 1802 of the
			 Social Security Act

header.#text:
Freedom of choice and contracting by patient
		  guaranteed

text.#text:
Any individual
				entitled to insurance benefits under this title may obtain health services from
				any institution, agency, or person qualified to participate under this title if
				such institution, agency, or person undertakes to provide that individual such
				services.

header.#text:
Freedom to
				contract by Medicare beneficiaries

text.#text:
Subject to the provisions of this subsection, nothing in
				this title shall prohibit a Medicare beneficiary from entering into a contract
				with an eligible professional for any item or service covered under this
				title.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
) in the payment area where the
				eligible professional covered by the contract resides. Payment made under this
				title for any item or service provided under the contract shall not render the
				eligible professional a participating or non-participating physician or
				supplier, and as such, requirements of this title that may otherwise apply to a
				participating or non-participating physician or supplier would not apply with
				respect to any items or services furnished under the contract.

text.#text:
Any Medicare beneficiary that enters into a contract under
				this section shall be permitted to submit a claim for payment under this title,
				and such payment shall be made in the amount that would otherwise apply under
				this title if such claim had been filed by a participating physician or

text.#text:
Nothing
				in this section shall be construed to prohibit any eligible professional from
				maintaining an election and acting as a participating or non-participating
				physician or supplier with respect to any patient not covered under a contract
				established under this section.

header.#text:
Preemption of
			 State laws limiting charges for services by an eligible professional

text.#text:
No State may impose a
			 limit on the amount of charges for services, furnished by an eligible
			 professional, for which payment is made under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, and any such limit is hereby
			 preempted.
